pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:0.5: 28. The training rule on boarding boats
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were boarding boats by arrangement with nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.4: “Just as we enjoy ourselves on boats with our wives, so these Sakyan monastics make arrangements with the nuns and then enjoy themselves on boats.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.5: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.6: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.7: “How can the monks from the group of six board boats by arrangement with nuns?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.11: “Foolish men, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.13: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.14.1: ‘If a monk boards a boat by arrangement with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:1.15: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.1: Soon afterwards a number of monks and nuns were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.2: On the way they needed to cross a river.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.3: The nuns said to the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.5: “Sisters, it’s not allowable for us to board a boat by arrangement with a nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.6: Either you cross first, or we will.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.9: But because the nuns crossed afterwards, they were robbed and raped by bandits.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.10: When they arrived at Sāvatthī they told the nuns there what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.11: The nuns then told the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.12: who in turn told the Buddha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.13: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.14: “Monks, I allow you to board a boat by arrangement with a nun if it’s for the purpose of crossing.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.15: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:2.16.1: ‘If a monk boards a boat by arrangement with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.6: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.10: if he makes an arrangement like this: he says, “Let’s board, Sister,” and she replies, “Yes, let’s board, Venerable;” or she says, “Let’s board, Venerable,” and he replies, “Yes, let’s board, Sister;” or he says, “Let’s board today,” “Let’s board tomorrow,” “Let’s board the day after tomorrow,” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.11: If the monk boards when the nun has already boarded, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.12: If the nun boards when the monk has already boarded, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.13: If they both board together, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.15: for the purpose of going against the stream.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.17: for the purpose of going with the stream.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.18: Except for the purpose of crossing:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.19: unless it is to go across.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.20: When the villages are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next village he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.1.21: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.1: If there is an arrangement, and he perceives that there is, and he boards a boat with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.2: If there is an arrangement, but he is unsure of it, and he boards a boat with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.3: If there is an arrangement, but he does not perceive that there is, and he boards a boat with a nun, either to go upstream or downstream, except for the purpose of crossing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.4: If the monk makes an arrangement, but the nun does not express her agreement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.5: If there is no arrangement, but he perceives that there is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.6: If there is no arrangement, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.2.7: If there is no arrangement, and he does not perceive that there is, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.2: if it is for the purpose of crossing;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.3: if they board without an arrangement;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.4: if the nun has made an arrangement, but he has not expressed his agreement;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.5: if they board, but not according to the arrangement;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc28:3.3.9: The training rule on boarding boats, the eighth, is finished.
